definition[0]: to write about something so that you have a record of it
example[0]: I wanted to set my feelings down on paper.
definition[1]: to state how something should be done in an official document or set of rules
example[1]: Clear guidelines have been set down for teachers.
definition[2]: to stop a car, bus etc and allow someone to get out
example[2]: The driver set her down at the station.
definition[3]: to establish rules, laws etc about how something should be done
example[3]: Banking regulators could set down similar rules for sales practices by banks.
